reviewText: Denise Austin has been making exercise videos for a LONG time, but this was my first DVD with her.  I'm glad I did it!  This DVD is divided into 4 segments which are:Warm-Up-A great warm-up that gets the blood flowing, then stretches you out.  It only lasts 5 minutes, but it is really nice.Cardio-This is composed of four 5-minute dance routines that gradually build up in intensity.  The first one just has you walk forward do a V step then come back.  After you do that step Denise adds on 1 or 2 other easy moves.  The second routine is just a little bit harder with some spins and a grapevine in it.  The third routine will start to get a little harder as Denise adds some knee steps and kicks.  The last one is the highest cardio of them all.  It is really fun, mixing Swing and Disco dance moves together.  All in all, it is easy enough for beginners, but if intermediates and advanced really throw themselves into this, they will get a cardio workout.  I am an advanced exerciser, and I got a pretty good workout.Toning-This is a strength routine that uses hand weights to get a good workout.  The level of work that you do depends on how many pounds your weights are.  I used 6.6 pound weights, and the next day my biceps, triceps, back, thighs, and glutes were sore.  Had I used 3 pound weights, I probably would not be sore.  Anyway, a great way to firm up!Stretch-Although the case says this is 5 minutes, it is only 4.  I just wanted to throw that in, but this is a still a good stretch.  It stretches legs and arms, and there are a few back and neck stretches, too.All in all, this is a good DVD if you will really throw yourself into the moves.  If you just do them, your heart rate might not get up.  Anyway, I recommend it to all fitness levels!
summary: A really good DVD for all exercise levels
Title: N/A

reviewText: The whole house party dance club idea is kind of a joke, but it did keep my heart rate up....not out of breath, but up. However, the second half of the tape is awesome. It's strength training, but Denis makes every exercise target atleast 3 areas of the body at once. So if you don't mind the goofy first part, the second half is worth the money.
summary: Dance Club - no, good workout - yes
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had been doing low impact aerobics for 2 months, I assumed I would have no problem working out for only 20 minutes, WRONG. I found myself sweating excessively just by doing the warm up. The cardio workout was exhausting, way too much jumping, bouncing and shaking for someone like me carrying an extra 50 lbs. I wouldn't recommend this DVD for beginners or those obese to severely obese, its all high impact no letting up, and forgot about the strengthening session, high impact, lots of squats.However, I plan to keep this DVD for the future when I'm down to my last 10 to 20 lbs to lose, less fat jiggling and stronger knees.
Title: N/A

reviewText: These are great because they're fun, short and you can mix and match.  Doing these workouts doesn't seem like just another task to get done during the day.  They're actually fun.  Plus, she does a good job of working with the upper body, too.  And it's nice that Denise is always positive and encouraging.
summary: Lot's of fun AND you get your exercise.  :-)

reviewText: Ok the first half the cardio dance party: there is very little dancing involved and alot of just bouncing back and fourth. Its an ok cardio workout and great for beginners. The Sculpting is awesome! It is also much more difficult. I never find myself doing both I use the first part when I am in poor shape and the second part when I am in great shape. I would suggest using 3lb weights when you start. If you can buy cheap its good to have because it is versatile, but if you are looking for a one-stop-shop this isn't your video.

reviewText: I got a used copy of this DVD and am glad I did not pay full price.Positive: The backdrop is really lovely. Looks like the exercisers are in a hotel lobby with a gorgeous water view behind them.Not so positive: Denise is your usual manic, breathless sounding, poor cueing self and the cardio really is a joke. Not much in terms of exertion or sweat induced there.Even her exercise team looked slightly embarrassed by her, but maybe I am projecting!The real saving grace of this DVD is the strength section. Well done Denise.. she gets in some good compound moves that work multiple muscle groups at once for a compact session that left my muscles achy - in a good way.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you enjoy dance moves like sashays, mambos and shaking your hips, you will like this easy going aerobic routine.  There are also some front kicks and repeaters included.  It is low impact for your knees.  It gets my heart rate up but it is not meant as a workout to get you out of breath.  The toning section can be modified with lighter or heavier free weights.  It is safe and effective and works all muscles head to toe.  It is also slightly aerobic since you are constantly moving the whole time.  The cool down is short, but relaxing.  There is a short warmup option before the aerobic section.  The aerobics and toning sections are both 20 minutes.  I enjoy doing all sections for a great workout.
summary: Fun, Dancy Aerobics and Sensible Toning Section
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have really enjoyed working out to this DVD, both the cardio & strength workouts are great workouts & the time flies by.  I have very little coordination & have had trouble in the past w/dance themed cardio workouts, but not w/this one.  It is a great cardio workout, even if you have no coordination.  The strength workout is good as well, it utilizes multiple muscle groups at once & incorporates some ab work.  I would recommend this DVD to anyone looking for a quick but effective cardio & strength workout.

reviewText: At last, a video that got my teenager to get up and exercise! For me (age 45) the dance steps are too complicated and the pace too slow; I improvise and do my own thing to keep up my heart rate. I can do that without knowing what a jazz square is. But the video is a good motivator even for a mom who can't keep up with jazz.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me start off by saying this would be a GREAT and fun workout if you are just starting out.  However, I was a bit disappointed due to the fact that I have been working my way up in intensity with workouts for the past year, working out at home at least 4-5 a week.  The cardio can be fun, but I was looking for a more intense workout...  I am looking for effective moves that I can do in a short period of time.. I felt like I wasted 20 minutes with the cardio portion.  But,,, because I love Denise, I tried it several more times and tried to up the intensity by incorporating new moves and  exaggerated the moves on the video.. but I found that I was changing the ENTIRE program, so definitely not worth it.However, on to the second part ~ the toning segment is great and very effective.  I use this as an add on to some of my more intense cardio dvd's.So, my two cents are that if you are a beginner, this is a great stepping stone to build on ~ if not, skip it and move on.I gave it three stars due to the fact that I currently use the toning section, as well as the fact that it may help others at their current level, but it is not in sync with mine right now.

reviewText: The Denise Austin DVD Burn Fat Fast Cardio, Dance and Sculpt is a high energy, fast paced, quick work out. The DVD provides users with several options. You can start with the warm up. It's always a good idea to warm up before you work out. The warm up/stretch portion of the DVD is 5 minutes long.The most exciting part of this DVD is the Cardio work out. It's a really fun dance work out. When you are actually doing the moves with Denise and the girls on the stage it's almost like you are at the club having a good time rather thank working out. The Cardio work out is 20 minutes long. The set is really nice too. Denise and the girls work out on the floor with an ocean view backdrop.The Strength portion of the DVD includes the use of hand weights. The use of the hand weights in this segment helps with shaping arms, the chest and shoulders. While using the weights you will still be working the core of your body to exercise the abs, hips, thighs and buttocks. If you have bad knees this portion of the DVD might be a challenge for you as there is some squatting involved and some exercises which require you to kneel on one knee at times.The Burn Fat Fast, Cardio Dance & Sculpt arrived in stores on December 20th. It's a fun high energy work out. Out of all the recent Denise Austin DVD releases this one is my favorite I like seeing the ocean in the background, I like the energy of it, it's really fun!

reviewText: I like Denise Austin workouts. The fit is perfect for me, as she's easy to follow, encouraging, motivating and the workouts are a good variety. I have other Denise Austin DVDs as well and they're all challenging enough.

reviewText: I would really recommend Denise's Indoor Walk dvd rather than this one, at least for beginners. This dvd has only one difficulty level, and the routine is fast paced and can be hard to follow for those who are not well-coordinated. This is better for those who are more experienced with working out. I had to set my copy aside for later, after I'm in better shape and have more experience with dvd workouts. Meanwhile I'm using her Indoor Walk dvd every day. Cardio Dance and Sculpt is a good workout, and if I could keep up I'd probably enjoy it, but I'm not there, at least not yet.

I used to take dance classes when I was younger but haven't for a long time but really wanted to try something new exercise wise and this hit the spot. reviewText: If I could give this 3.5 stars, I would.  Normally I like Denise Austin, but this DVD is not my first choice.  Most of the moves in the cardio section were fine, but some of them were so cheesy and dorky I felt ridiculous doing them.  The toning section is pretty good, but as usual she only does a few reps of each exercise.  I am keeping the DVD because I still do it now and then.  Sometimes I use the "dance" section as a warmup for other DVDs that don't have one or on days when I am sore/tired and don't want to workout.This DVD is good for people that need a lot of encouragement or are just beginning to workout.  You should just be aware that this DVD will probably not help most people lose weight or tone up quickly.  This is the DVD to do between days of more intense workouts.  For better toning exercises, I would suggest the Lotte Berk method and there are tons of cardio DVDs out there that are better than this.  I like Kathy Smith's Time Saver Cardio Fat Burner and The Firm's Maximum Calorie Burn better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD has a 5 min. warm-up, 2 short but effective workouts, and a 5 min. stretch.  The DVD gives lets you select:warm-up + 20 min. cardio + stretchwarm-up + 20 min. strength workout + stretchwarm-up + cardio + strengh + stretchYou can also play each segment individuallyThe 20 min. cardio section is a fun medley of easy to follow low-impact moves including some kickboxing.  Denise is encouraging and tells you "there's no wrong way, just keep moving".  The music is upbeat.  It's the same throughout both workouts, so it can get a little repetitive.The strength section is 20 min. long.  The 1st 15 min. is standing moves with weights.  You work your lower body and upper body simultaneously with lunges and plies combined with curls and overhead presses.  These moves target your buns, thighs, arms, chest and shoulders. The last 5 min. is abs focused moves with some upper body exercises as well.I really enjoyed this DVD. Denise doesn't rush through the workout.  She usually cues before each move.  I found it easy to follow and fun to do, and most importantly - effective.

reviewText: Denise is too perky, too chirpy and she fails to give guidance with her moves.  If you haven't been working out for very long, or if you have never had good instruction, it would be easy to injure yourself with all the flailing around Denise does.  I'll stick with Kathy Smith or Karen Voight or Lisa Hart.
summary: To the back of my shelf
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this DVD the other night when I made a trip to Best Buy to pick up some more Firm videos. Sadly, they didn't have any Firm tapes. The selection was limited to only a few instructors, most of which I had never heard of. I often work out to Denise in the morning (her Pilates program airs at 7am on Lifetime and her aerobics daily workout airs at 7:30) before doing my Firm tapes, I figured I would pick this up since I didn't own any of her tapes already.This DVD is divided into sections. There is a warm-up, a cardio section, and a section for weight training. I haven't yet done the weight training segment, but it does look effective and appears as though it could continue to be as long as you pyramid up with your weights as you get stronger. The cardio "dance party" is pretty energizing and only seems silly if other people are in the room with you. I'd never attempt this in front of others now that I have done it. I would feel too ridiculous :) This does get your heart rate up if you put the right engergy into each move.HOWEVER, that is one of the main problems I have with this tape. I don't know if others have felt the same way, but there are four girls doing the cardio workout in addition to Denise, and I really wish it was just Denise, or just her and the least annoying girl (in the red). The girl to the left of Denise in the blue is enough to drive anyone crazy. She often does additional motions that Denise doesn't even do. I get the feeling that she is really trying to "outdo" Denise. I have never found anyone on a fitness video to be annoying and didn't think I ever would, but this girl is seriously causing me to consider getting rid of this tape. She is very jerky with her movements and really over-exaggerates everything. I sound horrible complaining about something so trivial, but even my 10-year-old sister wanted to know what was "wrong" with her. I really wish they would have paid more attention to the additional girls when making this video because obviously someone was looking the other way!But, if you can handle extremely annoying side girls, then I really think you could benefit from this in the long-run. I do recommend...and I also recommend you focus on Denise!
summary: Beware of the girl in the blue!

reviewText: There is a good mix in here of cardio work followed by some serious toning.  This will have you burning fat off.  The problem I have with it is that the cardio section emphasizes movement and fun, not perfect form. She's always at one time or another off beat and that is off-putting.  She's too bubly and that's sickening when you're either exhausted or puffing too much.  The standing/floor toning is extra efficient because it works two muscle groups at once (e.g. an overhead press and a squat at the same time).  You will need dumbells, and a bit of space in front of the tv.  I like this, but with her lack of rythem and too much enthusiasm, I'd rather watch it with the sound down.
Title: N/A

reviewText: While some people are bothered by Denise's bubbly personality, I have to say I find it motivating.  I find myself really getting into the workout and even talking back to her on the DVD.  Who wants a bland host when your trying to motivate yourself to exercise?Anyway, the cardio section of this will definetely make you sweat and burn calories.  One of my only gripes is that it gets very repititive at times.  Like in the beginning, she has you doing a just a v-step for about 2 minutes straight.  Basically, in this segment, she teaches you 4 little dance routines and then you just repeat them for a few minutes each.  I admit the first time I did this, I got lost, but just stick with it and soon you will barely even have to look at the TV.  Oh, and if anyone can figure out how to cha-cha, let me know, cause I still can't get it months after trying.The strength training segment is much easier to follow and very likeable.  It manages to work just about all your muscles in only 20 minutes by combining several momevents at the same time - very efficient and intense.  If it gets too easy, just get heavier hand weights.  I like this segment very much and use it to supplement some of my other workout DVDs.A good choice if you like Denise and want to lose a little weight or even maintain it.  I weigh about 115, but I'm short, so I look a little pudgy in places.  I can't seem to get below this weight unless I starve myself, but DVDs like this help me maintain my weight when I don't always have time to eat properly.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The five minute warmup, twenty minute cardio dance, and five minute cooldown/stretch is a lot of fun to do.  If you enjoy dancing (and you don't have to be great at it!) and will enjoy Denise's bubbly personality, then I highly recommend this DVD.  And it's not one of those DVDs where you'll feel burned out with doing it either.  I use to do Charlene Prickett exercise videos but I'd feel exhausted after only five minutes and unable to finish.  With Denise, I feel my heart pumping but I also don't feel as if I cannot finish either.There is also a twenty minute toning component using weights.  This part of the DVD I don't care for, only because I like some of Denise's other DVDs better for toning.  So that is why I rate this DVD 4/5 stars.  But if you're on a budget this DVD can be implemented every day because it has everything you'll need - cardio, toning, and stretch.
summary: A Fun Cardio Workout with Denise!

reviewText: If you are looking for an energetic exercise routine that burns calories and sculpts your entire body, Burn Fat Fast may even make you feel more energetic at the end than when you started.Warm Up - 5-minutesCardio - 20-minute Dance-Themed House Party. This routine completely oxygenates the body and the dance-themed cardio made me feel like I was a college student having fun at the beach. That doesn't mean it was not challenging, the dance section is high energy, but especially enjoyable and playful.20-minute Strength Routine - Uses hand weights to shape the arms, chest and shoulders while also working the core to slim down the lower body. The additional creative challenges include doing two exercises at the same time. Like you may be lifting your leg and holding weights in your hands. This presents amazing balance challenges that I found to be especially enjoyable.If you have been consistently exercising with Yoga and Pilates DVDs, then this is your reward. When you meet the challenges, your self-esteem will soar and this workout starts to pay off even after just the first time you try the exercises.Cool Down - Stretching for 5-minutes to improve flexibility and posture.Highly recommended as a full-body workout that not only tones your entire body, it also boosts your metabolism. Five Stars for being completely FUN.~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A

reviewText: Aside from the fact that Denise Austin sounds like she should work for a phone sex line... I thought this dvd had some redeeming qualities. The "cardio" section was a joke, I honestly felt stupid doing it and I dont really have a problem with dancey cardio for the most part. My heart rate was actually higher during the strength training segment than the "cardio" segment. *scratches head* Thankfully you can completely skip over the "cardio" and pick the option for 'warm up - strength - cool down' on the dvd menu. But let me get on to the positive. I thought Denise's approach to strength training was pretty innovative and enjoyable. I really felt it in my abs with the floor work! Her compound movements with the weights were fresh to me and she did a good number of reps, enough for me to want to give in but few enough so I didnt. I used 5lb weights and I was comfortably challenged. I rented this from my library so I am not bitter about "wasting" money. I'll probably check it out again in the future to do that ab work, overall not a total loss but don't waste your time with the "cardio" section!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD offers a warmup, cardio dance workout, strength workout and a cooldown. The warm & cool are each about 5 minutes and the cardio & strength are each about 20 minutes.Warmup: This is a cardio-style warmup to get your heart rate up--marching, side-stepping, squats, lunges--but also includes some stretches.Cardio Workout: Denise calls this her "cardio house party" since it has some dancey moves in it such as the mambo and cha-cha. It felt like a bit of a Turbo Jam copy in that she's working overtime to make it FUN! There's even one move she almost called "shake & shed," which is one of Chalene's signature Turbo Jam moves. She tries for the "let's just have fun with the music" moves that Chalene uses in Turbo Jam, but I didn't find this nearly as much fun. In fact, sometimes I just felt embarassed, such as in one move where you alternate kicks with wiggling your [...] in the way a 3-year old girl does when she's learning to dance.Strength: Pretty basic strength moves with dumbbells but she also combines upper body strength moves with lower body squats, lunges and plies so you get a lower body benefit as well. There is some floor work for chest, buns and abs. I didn't do this entire workout (floor work) but it is a good overall workout.Cooldown: Pretty basic stretches.Things I didn't like:1. Denise feels the need to talk EVERY SECOND through every workout. Since so much of her talking feels forced and unnaturally perky (You can DO IT!), I wanted to throttle her within 5 minutes of every workout.2. Like Kathy Smith, Denise uses the string-moves-together-then-put-it-all-together method, which I happen to hate because it's hard to remember all the moves and what order they come in when you don't have a great memory.3. She's not very good at cueing. She'll say "Okay, now we're going to do something different!" but she doesn't say WHAT until you're already doing it. Or she'll say "Now we're going to do the _____" and use some name for a move I've never heard of before, so I don't consider that cueing. When she started putting moves together in a different sequence than I'd learned them, it was confusing.4. Her voice annoys me to no end--like someone trying to talk in an unnaturally low, breathy, sex-kitten voice.5. When Denise marches in places, she doesn't have her knees pointing forward like everyone else in the video (and just about everyone else in other workouts I've done). She points her knees inward as she walks which causes her hips to swivel dramatically. She looks like a majorette leading a marching band instead of a fitness trainer leading a workout.Clearly I'm not a Denise Austin fan. I've tried 2 of her workouts now and I find HER so obnoxious that it's hard for me to see through that to the benefits of her workouts. So take this review with a grain of salt.
summary: I can't get past Denise to enjoy the workouts.
